ElementDescription: The NDAR Global Unique Identifier (GUID) for research subject
Subject ID how it's defined in lab/project
Date on which the interview/genetic test/sampling/imaging/biospecimen was completed. MM/DD/YYYY
Age in months at the time of the interview/test/sampling/imaging.
Notes: Age is rounded to chronological month. If the research participant is 15-days-old at time of interview, the appropriate value would be 0 months. If the participant is 16-days-old, the value would be 1 month.

ElementDescription: Sex of subject at birth
Notes: M = Male; F = Female; O=Other; NR = Not reported

ElementDescription: Timepoint/visit label
Form used/assessment name
Notes: e.g., Self-Report, Parent Form, Short Form, Revised Version

ElementDescription: Respondent
Respondent details
The event name for which the data was collected
Has subject smoked within the last 30 days?
Has subject smoked more than 100 cigarettes in his/her life?
Total years smoked:
Average number of packs smoked per day:
Notes: 1= 1 Cigarette to less than half a pack; 2= Half a pack to less than 1 pack; 3= 1 pack to less than 1 and half packs; 4= 1 and a half packs to less than 2 packs; 5= 2 Packs or more; 9= Unknown

ElementDescription: If the subject quit smoking, specify the age at which he/she last smoked:
In the past three months, has the subject consumed any alcohol?
During the past three months, how often did the subject have at least one drink of any alcoholic beverage such as wine, beer, malt liquor, or spirits?
Notes: 0= Less than once a month; 1= About once a month; 2= About once a week; 3= A few times a week; 4= Daily or almost daily; 9= Unknown
